properties.description: Together with the arrival of the Bases Conversion and Development Authority (BCDA) came the arrival of a military detachment in the area.
Pag-kakarbon or charcoal-making is becoming one of the sources of income for the community especially now that their livelihood of farms and trees are at risk of being bulldozed.
The Chapel of Ali lie unrecognizable as it is now a pile of rubble. The church was one of the buildings demolished to make way for the roads of New Clark City.
The residents of Alli depend of springs or sibol for their water. There are several such springs located in the area.
Residents mention that a golf course is being build in one of the areas under development for New Clark City.
There used to be a house here until it was demolished to make way for New Clark City
Trees are marked to estimate the value of the land being claimed by the Bases Conversion and Development Authority (BCDA). Different kinds of trees have different prices.
Mountains and hills are being flattened and excavated in order to build roads to New Clark City.
